search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` count from datamodel=Authentication where `cs_authentication_indexes` `cs_authentication_app_filter` by Authentication.app | rename "Authentication.app" as app

| tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` prestats=t count as count, dc(Authentication.user) as dc_users from datamodel=Authentication where `cs_authentication_indexes` Authentication.action IN ("success","failure") Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ `cs_authentication_app_filter` by _time Authentication.action | timechart span=1h count, dc(Authentication.user) by Authentication.action | eval "Unique Users"='dc(Authentication.user): failure'+'dc(Authentication.user): success' | fields - "dc(Authentication.user): failure", "dc(Authentication.user): success" | rename "count: failure" as "Failure", "count: success" as "Success"

html.p: Description: Displays unusual behavior for users with a large number of failure attempts and abnormal behavior from the number of unique users.

search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` prestats=t count from datamodel=Authentication where `cs_authentication_indexes` nodename=Authentication.Failed_Authentication Authentication.action=failure Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ `cs_authentication_app_filter` by _time Authentication.signature | timechart span=1h count by Authentication.signature limit=0

html.p: Description: Displays any abnormalities that may have occurred or new spikes for a specific kind of failure that should be further investigated.

search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` prestats=t count from datamodel=Authentication where `cs_authentication_indexes` Authentication.app!=OktaIM2:log Authentication.action IN ("success","failure") Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ `cs_authentication_app_filter` by Authentication.app Authentication.action | chart count by Authentication.app Authentication.action | addtotals | eval "Success%" = round(success / Total * 100,2) | fields - Total | rename failure as "Failure", success as "Success" | where 'Success%' < 100 | sort + "Success%"

html.p: Description: A low authentication success rate should be further investigated to determine if this is an issue for a single user or of greater impact.
This dashboard includes all authentication attempts that are mapped with the Authentication CIM data model.
To filter through data or to only include specific kinds of data, update the "Authentication Data (indexes)" macro (cs_authentication_indexes) definition (Settings > Configuration).
You can also update `cs_authentication_app_filter` macro definition from "Settings > Configuration" page to filter any authentication data by app name.
